name: Trip Report: Air Berlin Dash-8 Q400, Stuttgart-Düsseldorf
description:
Fancy being a Patron? https://www.patreon.com/paulstripreports

Follow me on Instagram: paulstripreports ¦ https://www.instagram.com/paulstripreports/

Date of Travel: 06 APR 2017
Aircraft: Dash 8 Q400
Tail: D-ABQJ
Livery: Air Berlin standard
Route: STR-DUS
Weather on Departure: Cloudy, winds 10kts
Weather on Arrival: Overcast, winds 10kts
Airborne Time: 0h48m
Miles: 210
Remarks: My first Air Berlin flight


Thanks for finding my video and pressing play! 

In this trip, I take one of Air Berlin’s Q400 aircraft between Stuttgart and Dusseldorf. I’m in a preferred seat, which is at the front of economy and directly behind business class (which AB only introduced recently). 

While I don’t like Q400 aircraft, they’re hardy and basic and do the job just fine. This was a no-fuss flight with Air Berlin, who occupy a strange niche as a pseudo-low cost carrier.

Happy Easter and see you next Sunday…
